author: {'steamid': '76561198015466047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1503723590}
review:
You know the top-down, pseudo-strategic gameplay of a lot of free-to-play titles offer these days?  Heroes of Shadow Guard minimizes that to a first-person, claustrophobic dungeon crawler, where the longer you take to navigate literal labyrinths means more encounters to drain your health, mana, and items.

I originally thought to write this off, but came back to it on a whim and now realize how complex this game really is.  I didn’t appreciate it until I invested the time and head knowledge to really understand the gameplay.

Yes, it’s a mobile port.  Who cares?!  It’s very deep for a mobile game and not at all as simple as it looks.  You can play it very simply: apply XP potions, auto-equip better gear, instantly complete unlocked quests, let the computer run your battles for you.  Most daily bonuses take a few minutes of your day and provide many bonuses and rewards.  You can slowly rise your party to sufficient power to a point you just auto-resolve every encounter with ease.

Or, you can go hardcore, nitpicking which Gems to apply 4% bonuses to, max out specific skills, mix and match Pets between party members, swap out Heroes to evenly distribute XP earned.  You can fight tooth and nail wading through enemy players’ mazes, scraping by to maximize rank points.

Completing a labyrinth is often no easy task.  It requires lots of concentration to minimize steps (thus minimizing number of encounters).  I frequently find myself frantically rushing the final chest, one-shotting the boss with a javelin, and completing the maze.  Staying and grinding is a huge risk to your success.

I feel like a lot of balancing is warranted, but it doesn’t bother me a lot.  Just because you have access to the strongest items doesn’t make them viable for low-level players: they’ll drain your Gold sooner or later.  The $3, 100 premium currency daily for a month is a steal, and I’m not complaining; it’s another great reason to log in and check dailies.  The shield (preventing other players from raiding you) is reset every day and after every time you’re raided; probably also needs balance, but I’m still not complaining.

Heroes of Shadow Guard strikes a special mix of casualness and involvement.  The amount of time you spend grinding and customizing labyrinths is a lot longer than you’d think.  The amount of time you spend just checkin’ in for daily rewards is appropriately short.  There’s a world of complexity waiting for proper capitalization.  Ignore the plain visuals: this game has a lot to offer for the low price of “free.”

author: {'steamid': '76561198124491217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1499961510}
review: A mediocre Russian mobile port. It certainly isn't the worst, but it goets boring pretty quickly. The idea of making dungeons and raid other players' dungeons is interesting but the severe lack of item variety, the ugly palette swapped textures on the walls and floors, and the garbage royalty-free music and sound effects make this a pass until they convert this into a fully fleshed PC game. Move along, comrade.

review:
Heroes of Shadow Guard is a free to play Mobile game that is a Retro-like turn-based RPG.  It worked on Win 10, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  Sort of like Mighty Quest for Epic Loot but more crappy looking.  The artwork is like cheap looking, low rez, that a child can draw.  Not a good game for the pc.  Game is Pay to Win.
Try it only, if you like mobile games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104906686', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1526759989}
review:
I see the game and gave me the might and magic vibe.
I like it.
I downladed the game.
I open the game.
The game opens and takes 10 years to download idfk what.
Finaly done and get into it.
I play frue the first dungeon and try to click every pot I see.(it was fun)
Than I get into the character costumisation.
I click on axe to equip and game crashed...
I open again and try to equip axe again.
Crash...
After 10 million tries it finaly works and keep going.
The game tells me to click on dungeon.
I click on it and than the tutorial glitched and it didn't let me get passed that step.
I exit game.
I went to steam.
I right click the game.
And finaly something worked for once.
99999/10 for the uninstall buton working
Also the game shod get better in time so try again later

author: {'steamid': '76561198000368827', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1470971878}
review:
Gameplay is boring. The maps are small and samey. The combat is repetitive and shallow. No real feeling of progression. Story is generic what there is of it, and non-engaging. UI is VERY clunky. Game started with sound and music muted for some reason. There are supposedly some multiplayer aspects but they are not clear. You can "design" your own dungeon, but that just means drawing a tiny map and putting some unexplained things there. There is some sort of management aspect to this, but since I didn't see what the overall goal of the game was, it didn't seem neccessary.

Not good even as a free timewaster. I do not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157308647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1471081044}
review:
A free game with an interesting mix of dungeon crawling and dungeon mastering.

On PC it looks clunky, but if you can get over that, its a fun little game to kill some time.

I've always liked the idea behind games with user-generated dungeons (Castle Doctrine, Quest for Epic Loot).  Nothing is as satisfying as watching some shmoe enter your dungeon, get turned-all-around, and eventually die.

Game has some balance issues, but that could be ironed out reasonably quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055311780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2431, 'last_played': 1472114672}
review:
A MOBILE PORT!

Just throwing this out there because I know a lot of people hate mobile ports like the 2nd coming of Satan.
The game is mediocre which isn't a bad thing because it does have a good idea however...

[url]http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/263844100806115112/F21B7C379E412C57210082EB2197B21A6E60819A/[/url]

There are a lot of bugs and without explaining every single bug you will find I will warn you about one of the earlier ones that will crash your game which is being idle/afk. If you decide to go out for awhile and leave the game running or even take a poo, the game will crash. What is supposed to happen is that the game logs you out. Why? Because its a mobile port. When this doesn't work as intended, for example, you are in a shop menu, the game just crashes.

Even looking past the crashes however the game is a bit boring. Fun is there, to be had, but the shackles of mobile gaming hang around your neck in all its usual "glory". Having a good time? Well you have run out of "energy" and now you need to either spend more cash money or wait until the game says you can play it again.

Then there are rules in the game such as that you need to level up your minions. Failure to do so makes your dungeon an easy target. The level up system has a bug in it so it will take more credits than it says it will. Sorry, I did say I would [i]stop[/i] talking about the bugs didn't I.

Then there is the crafting system, repeat after me "obtain x, y, z ingredients and then upgrade your items" because that is the only way that crafting works.

I did have fun with the game, its a nice dungeon crawler and if you like Etrian oddyssy...You might want to enjoy this like I did. There is hope for the game if it makes itself closer to a PC game and further from a bland mobile port, it does have a future in a niche market but the keyword is "if".

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198066319925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1482175428}
review:
Let me start by saying, I am really enjoying this game so far. I like old-school dungeon crawlers, and with the unique aspect of creating your own labyrinth for other people to raid is really neat. I like that you can craft your own gear and weapons, and upgrade Hero skills...as a WoW player, these apeal to me. The game is not without it's flaws though.

Pros:

- First person dungeon crawling, with multible Heroes of different classes and skills.
- Creating your own lab for people to try and raid. 
- Gear and weapon crafting.
- Cross platform.

Cons:

- Low resolution on certain things in game.
- Finding bugs (but it just came out, so I'm sure they will be fixed).

Overall, I think it's a really cool game and would definitely recommend the download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036668624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1475241090}
review:
A very good and well made game
but there is one downfall regarding the energy ressource 
-> You dont have much energy so you can do many attacks 
-> You only regain 10% per hour , what isnt enough to play the game regulary
-> Only one option to get more energy is buying , but the price is WAY too high

---> Perfect game , if those things would get fixed and we could play this game regulary instead of attack 8 times and go offline just to wait 10 hours until the energy is full again :)

review: Game for fans of Dungeon Crawlers. Like for free game isn't so bad. It's have bugs that's for sure but they will repair them. For now, it's interesting position for like I say, fans of RPG Dungeon Crawlers. You don't buying it so you can just check it, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561198083919825', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1470283086}
review:
In my 5 minutes of playing this game I could tell it was created by one of the most intelligent individules I have ever thought of. Clearly his skills in game design are far more superior than those of some AAA titles such as Borderlands, Call of Duty, and Fallout. Thank you so much for creating a game like this. I think I'm going to take a little break from it for a little while, maybe a few decades. 

Wontohn

author: {'steamid': '76561198118969424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1470514830}
review:
As per the description, it's a cross-platform game - so you get everything that comes along with it: the UIs aren't PC targeted and neither are the graphics.  However, some of the visuals are actually pretty nice, and the concept is very original.  If you're into turn-based dungeon crawlers - something with a multiplayer spin like this is really cool.

Definitely worth the download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059336756', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1470272723}
review: I'm not going to put any time in on this game. Not because it's horrendous, or offensive, or really all that bad. It's just small. It's a mobile port. Which, in and of it's self isn't an issue I suppose, but they're inherently small, far too small for something like this. What it does works, in a cute little way, it's just not finished. To play it much further would, to me, almost seem indecent. It feels naked to me. So, being that it's free, and that it isn't offensively bad, (Except for the music, what the hell.) i'm going to say it's worth looking into in the future, if the developer cares enough about the game to make it a full fledged PC game. Dungeon builders CAN be great, but this formula is limiting. So my message to other players is; avoid it for now, try it in a month. My message to the developers; Go sit in time out for a minute. It was bad of you to release this in the condition it's in. Try harder. I'm not mad, i'm just dissapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041854523', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1471555240}
review:
My Experiance soo far:
Game: Here, let me guide you on how to play.
Me: No thanks, im good...
Game: Here, Let me hold your hand through the dungeon.
Me: I said No! I know how WASD and Turn based works!
Game: Press Click to attack
Me: I KNOW HOW THIS WORKS! WHERE DO I TURN YOU OFF?!
[Later]
Me: Oh, yea... I like Dungeon Building...
*Fiddles with it a little.
Me: This is not the best but...
*Selects Guards*
Me: Ok so how Do I place these guys?
*Fiddles with it some more*
Me: I can't place guards..... What the Hell...
[More Later]
Me: Wait a minute... there's a few tabs... there's this... Energy Tab there... Wait... no....
Oh God please no... Don't tell me...! *Clicks on the Purple Pickaxe* OH I F*CKEN KNEW IT!!! I F*CKEN KNEW IT!!!
THIS IS A F*CKING MOBILE GAME! I F*CKING KNEW IT!!!
[Even More Later]
*Decides to check Factions
*Only 4 unoriginal Named Factions
*Tries to create the D!ckButt Inquisitions
*Profanity
*More attempts
*16 or somewat words or less
*Shortens
*Profanity
*Rages
*Finally makes the Faction called "DekBute Inquisit."
*No Regrets
[1 Hour later]
Me: Already... #1 Player on the Top Players list..... Well..... That was Easy.....

4/10 Needs to be less "Mobile" and more "PC".

author: {'steamid': '76561198076607591', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1470264569}
